edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Interface ChooserConfiguration


  • public interface ChooserConfiguration
    The ChooserConfiguration interface describes the key characteristics of the level chooser screens. The chooser consists of a bunch of screens, each containing a bunch of Level buttons, which are used to choose specific levels to play. There are also buttons for going back to the splash screen, and for moving among the screens of the chooser.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      The height of the "back to splash" button
      java.lang.String getBackButtonName()
      The image to display as the "back to splash" button

      The width of the "back to splash" button
      int getBackButtonX()
      The X coordinate of the bottom left corner of the "back to splash" button
      int getBackButtonY()
      The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner of the "back to splash" button
      java.lang.String getBackgroundName()
      This is the name of the background image to display on the Chooser scenes
      int getBPadding()
      This is the vertical space between buttons
      int getColumns()
      Each chooser screen will have a bunch of buttons for playing specific levels.
      int getHPadding()
      This is the horizontal space between buttons
      int getLeftMargin()
      This is the space, in pixels, between the left of the screen and the first column of buttons
      int getLevelButtonHeight()
      This is the height of each level button's image
      java.lang.String getLevelButtonName()
      This is the name of the image that is displayed for each "level" button, behind the text for that button
      int getLevelButtonWidth()
      This is the width of each level button's image
      java.lang.String getLevelFont()
      This is the name of the font to use when making the "level" buttons
      int getLevelFontBlue()
      This is the blue component of the font for level buttons
      int getLevelFontGreen()
      This is the green component of the font for level buttons
      int getLevelFontRed()
      This is the red component of the font for level buttons
      int getLevelFontSize()
      This is the font size for the "level" buttons
      java.lang.String getLevelLockText()
      This is the text to display on locked levels...
      java.lang.String getMusicName()
      This is the name of the music file to play for the Chooser scenes

      The height of the "next chooser screen" button

      The image to display as the "next chooser screen" button

      The width of the "next chooser screen" button

      int getRows()
      Each chooser screen will have a bunch of buttons for playing specific levels.
      int getTopMargin()
      This is the space, in pixels, between the top of the screen and the first row of buttons
      boolean showChooser()
      Return true if pressing 'play' should result in the level-chooser screen showing; return false if pressing 'play' should immediately start level one.

    • Method Detail

      • getRows

        int getRows()
        Each chooser screen will have a bunch of buttons for playing specific levels. This defines the number of rows of buttons on each screen.

      • getColumns

        int getColumns()
        Each chooser screen will have a bunch of buttons for playing specific levels. This defines the number of columns of buttons on each screen.

        This is the space, in pixels, between the top of the screen and the first row of buttons
